Cardiff.
                                                                            –3–                      N18/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                       Notes                 Total
1.     a                                                                   3.4 × 10−1 kg m s−1 » ✔
                 change in momentum each second = 6.6 × 10−6 × 5.2 × 104 « =
                                                                                                                             2
                              3.4 × 10−1
                  = «= » 4.6 × 10−4 « m s−2 » ✔
                 acceleration
                                 740
1.     b    i    ALTERNATIVE 1:
                 (considering the acceleration of the spacecraft)
                                            30
                 time for acceleration
                            = =                      «4.6 × 106 » « s » ✔
                                        6.6 × 10 −6
                 max speed = «answer to (a) × 4.6 × 106 = » 2.1× 103 « m s−1 » ✔

                 ALTERNATIVE 2:                                                                                              2
                 (considering the conservation of momentum)

                 (momentum of 30 kg of fuel ions = change of momentum of spacecraft)

                 30 × 5.2 × 10 4 = 710 × max speed ✔

                 max speed = 2.2 × 103 « m s−1 » ✔
1.     b    ii   as fuel is consumed total mass changes/decreases so acceleration
                 changes/increases

                 OR                                                                                                          1

                 external forces (such as gravitational) can act on the spacecraft so acceleration
                 isn’t constant ✔

                                                                                                                      (continued…)
                                                                             –4–              N18/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


(Question 1 continued)

      Question                                          Answers                               Notes                 Total
 1.     b    iii   problem may be too complicated for exact treatment ✔
                   to make equations/calculations simpler ✔
                                                                                                                   1 max
                   when precision of the calculations is not important ✔

                   some quantities in the problem may not be known exactly ✔
 1.     c    i     ions have same (sign of) charge ✔
                                                                                                                      2
                   ions repel each other ✔
 1.     c    ii    the forces between the ions do not affect the force on the spacecraft. ✔
                                                                                                                      2
                   there is no effect on the acceleration of the spacecraft. ✔
                                                                        –5–                             N18/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                         Answers                                                  Notes                          Total
2.     a          ALTERNATIVE 1:

                         ρl            7.2 × 10 −7 × 12.5
                   r=          OR                         ✔
                         πR                 π × 0.1
                =r 5.352 × 10 −3 ✔                            For MP2 accept any SF

                   5.4 × 10 −3 «m» ✔                          For MP3 accept only 2 SF
                                                              For MP3 accept ANY answer given to 2 SF
                                                                                                                                3
                  ALTERNATIVE 2:
                        7.2 × 10 −7 × 12.5
                   A=                      ✔
                               0.1
                =r 5.352 × 10 −3 ✔                            For MP2 accept any SF
                                                              For MP3 accept only 2 SF
                   5.4 × 10 −3 «m» ✔
                                                              For MP3 accept ANY answer given to 2 SF
2.     b                              5
                  current in lamp =      «= 0.21» «A»
                                      24
                  OR
                              8                                                                                                 2
                  n 24 ×
                  =             ✔
                              5

                  so «38.4 and therefore» 38 lamps ✔          Do not award ECF from MP1

                                                                             –6–                                         N18/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


(Question 2 continued)

      Question                             Answers                                                           Notes                                   Total
 2.     c                                                                      Accept converse arguments for adding lamps in series:
                 when adding more lamps in parallel the brightness stays       when adding more lamps in series the brightness decreases
                 the same ✔
                 when adding more lamps in parallel the pd across each         when adding more lamps in series the pd decreases
                 remains the same/at the operating value/24 V ✔
                 when adding more lamps in parallel the current through        when adding more lamps in series the current decreases
                 each remains the same ✔
                 lamps can be controlled independently ✔                       lamps can’t be controlled independently                               1 max
                 the pd across each bulb is larger in parallel ✔               the pd across each bulb is smaller in series
                 the current in each bulb is greater in parallel ✔             the current in each bulb is smaller in series
                 lamps will be brighter in parallel than in series ✔
                 In parallel the pd across the lamps will be the operating     in series the pd across the lamps will less than the operating
                 value/24 V ✔                                                  value/24 V
                                                                               Do not accept statements that only compare the overall
                                                                               resistance of the combination of bulbs.

                                                                                                                                                (continued…)
                                                                         –7–           N18/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


(Question 2 continued)

      Question                             Answers                             Notes                         Total
 2.     d    i    «as flux linkage change occurs in core, induced emfs
                  appear so» current is induced ✔
                  induced currents give rise to resistive forces ✔

                                                                                                            2 max
                  eddy currents cause thermal energy losses «in
                  conducting core» ✔
                  power dissipated by eddy currents is drawn from the
                  primary coil/reduces power delivered to the secondary ✔
 2.     d    ii   power = 190 OR 192 «W» ✔
                                          100
                  required power =190 ×       «=200 or 202 W » ✔
                                           95
                       200                                                                                     4
                  so       = 0.83 OR 0.84 «A rms» ✔
                       240

                               « 0.83 × 2 OR 0.84 × 2 » = 1.2/1.3
                  peak current =
                  «A» ✔

     Question                                     Answers                                         Notes                             Total
3.     a          force × time
                  OR                                                                                                                  1
                  change in momentum ✔
3.     b    i     Ek = mgh = 0.058 × 9.81× 1.1 = 0.63 J ✔                   Allow use of g = 10 m s-2 (which gives 0.64 «J»)
                                                                                                                                      1
                                                                            Substitution and at least 2 SF must be shown
3.     b    ii    ALTERNATIVE 1:                                            Accept negative acceleration and force.

                                                          0.27 kg m s−1 »
                                   mv =2 × 0.058 × 0.63 « =
                  initial momentum =
                  OR
                                            « 0.27 kg m s−1 » ✔
                  mv= 0.058 × 2 × 9.81× 1.1 =

        change in momentum 0.27
=force «= »                      ✔
                time       0.055
                  4.9 «N» ✔
                  F − mg = 4.9 so F = 5.5 «N» ✔                                                                                       4

                 ALTERNATIVE 2:
                     1
                 «Ek =
                 =     mv 2 0.63 J » v = 4.7 m s-1 ✔
                     2
                               ∆v   4.7
                  acceleration
                          = «= »       = «85 m s-2 »✔
                               ∆t 55 x10 −3

                  4.9 «N» ✔

                  F − mg = 4.9 so F = 5.5 «N» ✔

(Question 3 continued)

      Question                                     Answers                                        Notes                      Total
 3.     b    iii   ALTERNATIVE 1:                                           Allow reverse argument for grass.

                   concrete reduces the stopping time/distance ✔

                   impulse/change in momentum same so force greater
                   OR
                   work done same so force greater ✔                                                                           2

                   ALTERNATIVE 2:

                   concrete reduces the stopping time ✔

                   deceleration is greater so force is greater ✔

     Question                                         Answers                                                  Notes                          Total
4.     a    i      horizontal line shown in centre of pipe ✔                                                                                   1
4.     a    ii     «air molecule» moves to the right and then back to the left ✔
                                                                                                                                               2
                   returns to X/original position ✔
4.     b                                2.8 m » ✔
                              2 × 1.4 « =
                   wavelength =

                 =   f λ » 120 × 2.8 « = 340 m s−1 » ✔
                  c «=
                                                                                                                                               4
                          2
                   K « ρ c=
                   =        1.3 × 3402 = » 1.5 × 105 ✔

                   kg m−1 s−2 ✔
4.     c    i      construction showing formation of image ✔                           Another straight line/ray from image through the
                                                                                       wall with line/ray from intersection at wall back to    1
                                                                                       transmitter. Reflected ray must intersect boat.
4.     c    ii     interference pattern is observed
                   OR
                   interference/superposition mentioned ✔

                                                                                                                                               2
                   maximum when two waves occur in phase/path difference is nλ
                   OR
                   minimum when two waves occur 180 out of phase/path difference is
                   (n + ½) λ ✔

                  identifies λ = 435 nm ✔

                         hc        6.63 × 10 −34 × 3 × 108
                  E =«        =»                           ✔                                                                               3
                         λ              4.35 × 10 −7

                  4.6 ×10−19 « J» ✔


5.     a    ii    -0.605 OR –0.870 OR –1.36 to –5.44 AND arrow pointing downwards ✔                    Arrow MUST match calculation in
                                                                                                       (a)(i)                              1
                                                                                                       Allow ECF from (a)(i)
5.     a    iii   Difference in energy levels is equal to the energy of the photon ✔
                                                                                                                                           2
                  Downward arrow as energy is lost by hydrogen/energy is given out in the photon/the
                  electron falls from a higher energy level to a lower one ✔

      Question                                   Answers                                                           Notes                           Total
 5.     b    i      λ   656.20                                                          Allow use of either wavelength or the mean value
                   = = 1813 « lines » ✔
                   2∆λ 0.181× 2                                                         Must see at least 2 SF for a bald correct answer
                                                                                                                                                     2
                                  3.5 × 10−3
                    so spacing is            « = 1.9 × 10−6 m » ✔
                                    1813
 5.     b    ii     2 × 4.1× 10 –7 = 1.9 × 10−6 sin θ v seen
                    OR
                    6.6 × 10−7 =1.9 × 10−6 sin θr seen ✔

                    θ=
                     v 24 − 26 «  »                                                                                                                 3
                    OR
                    θ=
                     r 19 − 20 «  » ✔

                    ∆θ= 5 − 6 «  » ✔                                                   For MP3 answer must follow from answers in MP2
                                                                                        For MP3 do not allow ECF from incorrect angles
 5.     b    iii    centre of pattern is white ✔
                    coloured fringes are formed ✔
                    blue/violet edge of order is closer to centre of pattern

                    OR
                                                                                                                                                  3 max
                    red edge of order is furthest from centre of pattern ✔

                    the greater the order the wider the pattern ✔

                    there are gaps between «first and second order» spectra ✔

     Question                                 Answers                                               Notes                                Total
6.     a    i    it is constant ✔                                                                                                          1
       a    ii   R = 1.20 × 10 −15 × 313 = 3.8 × 10 −15 « m » ✔
                                          1
                                                                       Must see working and answer to at least 2SF                         1
6.     b    i    separation for interaction = 5.3 or 5.5 «fm» ✔                                                                            1
6.     b    ii                                 15e 2                   Allow ecf from (b)(i)
                 energy required =                           ✔
                                        4πε 0 × 5.3 × 10 −15                                                                               2
                                 = 6.3 × 10 −13 «J» ✔
           = 6.5 / 6.6 × 10 −13 OR
6.     c         «electron» antineutrino also emitted ✔
                                                                                                                                           2
                 energy split between electron and «anti»neutrino ✔
6.     d    i    probability of decay of a nucleus ✔
                 OR
                 the fraction of the number of nuclei that decay
                                                                                                                                           2
                 in one/the next second
                 OR
                 per unit time ✔
6.     d    ii      = 6.05 × 105 « s » ✔
                 1 week                                                Award [2 max] if answer is not in seconds

                 17 = 24e − λ ×6.1×10 ✔

                                                                       If answer not in seconds and no unit quoted award [1 max] for       3
                                                                       correct substitution into equation (MP2)
                 5.7 × 10 −7 «s-1» ✔

7.     a        charge stored on capacitor =12 × 10−3 × 7.5 =0.09 «C» ✔                                                            1

7.     b                                    1      1      1                                     Allow use of g = 10 m s-2 which
                energy stored in capacitor « CV 2or QV = » × 12 × 10−3 × 7.52 « = 0.338 J » ✔   gives 0.25 «m»
                                            2      2      2
                                                                                                                                   2
                        1     0.338
                       « ×
                height =                    » 0.25/0.26 «m» ✔
                                            =
                        3 9.81× 4.5 × 10 −2
7.     c        C halved ✔                                                                      Allow 6 mF
                so energy stored is halved/reduced so rises «less than» half height ✔                                              3
                discharge time/raise time less as RC halved/reduced ✔

     Question                                               Answers                                                   Notes             Total
8.     a    i    force per unit mass ✔
                                                                                                                                          2
                 acting on a small/test/point mass «placed at the point in the field» ✔
8.     a    ii   Mars is spherical/a sphere «and of uniform density so behaves as a point mass» ✔
                 satellite has a much smaller mass/diameter/size than Mars «so approximates to a point                                    2
                 mass» ✔
8.     b    i        mv 2 GMm             GM            2π R
                 «       =   2
                               hence» v =    . Also v =
                      r    r               R             T

                 OR

                           GMm             GM
                 mω 2r =      2
                                hence ω 2 = 3 ✔
                            r              R

                                                         4 π2 3                                          Unit not required                3
                 uses either of the above to get T 2 =       R
                                                         GM
                 OR
                            4π 2
                 uses k =        ✔
                            GM

                  9.2 × 10 −13 / 9.3 × 10 −13 ✔
                 k=

                           ( 8.9 × 10 ) =

                   =   ωr

                     OR

                   =v «       =                              7

                     use of I ∝           «1.36 × 103 ×      »✔
                                      r 2

 8.     c    ii               600
                     use of       for mean intensity ✔
                               4

                                                      600
                   temperature/K
                   =                        «=
                                             4
                                               −8
                                                                   » 230 ✔
                                                4 × 5.67 × 10
 8.     c    iii     reference to greenhouse gas/effect ✔                                     The greenhouse effect can be described, it
                                                                                              doesn’t have to be named
                     recognize the link between molecular density/concentration and
                     pressure ✔
                     low pressure means too few molecules (to produce a significant heating
                                                                                                                                               3
                     effect) ✔
                     OR
                     low pressure means too little radiation re-radiated back to Mars ✔
                                                                              – 17 –                                      N18/4/PHYSI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                   Answers                                                           Notes                              Total
9.     a           Internal energy is the sum of all the PEs and KEs of the              Molecules/particles/atoms must be included once, if not,
                   molecules (of the oxygen) ✔                                           award [1 max]
                   PE of molecules in gaseous state is zero ✔
                                                                                                                                                     2 max
                   (At boiling point) average KE of molecules in gas and liquid is the
                   same ✔

                   gases have a higher internal energy ✔
9.     b    i      ALTERNATIVE 1:

                   flow rate of oxygen = 8 « g s−1 » ✔

                    « 2.1× 105 × 8 × 10−3 » =1.7 « kW » ✔
                                                                                                                                                       2
                   ALTERNATIVE 2:
                   Q « 0.25 × 32 × 10 −3 × 2.1× 10=
                   =                              5
                                                    » 1680 « J » ✔
                         1680 W » 1.7 « kW » ✔
                  power «=
                  =
9.     b    ii     T = 260 «K» ✔
                     nRT                                                                                                                               2
                 =V «= » 4.9 × 10−3 « m3 » ✔
                      p

(Question 9 continued)

      Question                             Answers                                                    Notes                               Total
 9.     c        ideal gas has point objects ✔                             Allow the opposite statements if they are clearly made about
                                                                           oxygen eg oxygen/this can be liquified
                 no intermolecular forces ✔
                 non liquefaction ✔                                                                                                       1 max
                 ideal gas assumes monatomic particles ✔

                 the collisions between particles are elastic ✔
